skill.name: denario
skill.description: Multiagent AI system for scientific research assistance that automates research workflows from data analysis to publication. This skill should be used when generating research ideas from datasets, developing research methodologies, executing computational experiments, performing literature searches, or generating publication-ready papers in LaTeX format. Supports end-to-end research pipelines with customizable agent orchestration.
skill.summary: Multiagent AI system for scientific research assistance that automates research workflows from data ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The scanned files are documentation and configuration metadata only. No executable code, scripts, or tool calls are present, and the content matches the stated research assistance purpose.

content.value_statement: Research workflows are slow and fragmented across many steps. This skill turns a data description into ideas, methods, results, and a journal style paper.
actual_capabilities: Generate research ideas from a data description
Create structured methodologies for a study
Execute computational analyses and produce results
Generate a publication ready LaTeX paper
Support journal formatting such as APS
limitations: Requires external LLM API keys and configuration
LaTeX must be installed or used via Docker
Literature search API details are not specified in the docs

use_cases.title: End to end pipeline
use_cases.description: Automate idea, method, results, and paper generation for a new study.

use_cases.title: Method and results
use_cases.description: Generate methodology and run analyses for a prepared dataset.

use_cases.title: Paper formatting
use_cases.description: Turn existing results into a journal formatted LaTeX manuscript.

prompt_templates.title: Start with data
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a dataset and tools list
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Denario to generate a research idea from this dataset description and tools list. Summarize the idea in one paragraph.

prompt_templates.title: Build a method
prompt_templates.prompt: Set this research idea and generate a detailed methodology. Include analysis steps, validation, and expected outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Run the analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute the methodology for my project directory and produce results with figures. Summarize the key findings.

prompt_templates.title: Write the paper
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a publication ready paper in APS format using the current idea, method, and results in my project.

output_examples.input: Generate a research idea and method for a climate time series dataset with pandas and scipy tools.
output: Research idea focuses on long term warming trends and seasonality
Methodology includes preprocessing, trend analysis, and significance tests
Planned outputs list figures for trend lines and decadal averages

best_practices: Provide detailed data descriptions with tools, domain, and constraints
Review and refine ideas and methods before running results
Use version control to track each pipeline stage
anti_patterns: Running results without setting data description and idea
Skipping review of generated methodology before execution
Expecting paper compilation without LaTeX installed

faq.question: What systems are supported?
faq.answer: Documentation targets Linux, macOS, and Windows with Python 3.12 or higher.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It depends on external LLM access and requires LaTeX for PDF output.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, you can set idea, method, or results from files and continue the pipeline.

faq.question: How is data safety handled?
faq.answer: The docs recommend using environment variables or .env files for API keys.

faq.question: What if I get API key errors?
faq.answer: Check environment variables or .env loading before importing the library.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual workflows?
faq.answer: It automates idea, method, results, and paper generation while keeping outputs in files.
